verses.roman:
kṛto hiraṇyanābhasya
catur-viṁśati saṁhitāḥ
śiṣya ūce sva-śiṣyebhyaḥ
śeṣā āvantya ātmavān

synonyms: kṛtaḥ—Kṛta; hiraṇyanābhasya—of Hiraṇyanābha; catuḥ-viṁśati—twenty-four; saṁhitāḥ—collections; śiṣyaḥ—the disciple; ūce—spoke; sva-śiṣyebhyaḥ—to his own disciples; śeṣāḥ—the remaining (collections); āvantyaḥ—Āvantya; ātma-vān—the self-controlled.
translation: Kṛta, the disciple of Hiraṇyanābha, spoke twenty four saṁhitās to his own disciples, and the remaining collections were passed down by the self-realized sage Āvantya.
